entry.title: Combined summary - New difficulty algorithm part 2
entry.summary: The discussion revolves around the feasibility of a hard fork in Bitcoin and various aspects related to it. One of the main points discussed is how large blocks can reduce network security while providing higher total transaction fees to miners. Miners prioritize profitability and will choose to mine the chain that yields more rewards in fees and/or higher-valued tokens. Hodlers hold 90% of the coin and lobby for security and price increases while users care most about stability rather than price. Devs are a governing authority under the influence of users, hodlers, and miners, and should strive for an expansion of the coin quantity to keep value constant which is the foundation of the 5 characteristics of an ideal currency. It is noted that all chains must follow the same difficulty adjustment and that hardforks are generally a dangerous invitation to disaster. The statement made by ZmnSCPxj via bitcoin-dev that most Core developers hold vast amounts of Bitcoin and any hardfork going against Core's wishes will collapse due to their hodling capacity is not entirely true. While Core developers may have influence over the direction of Bitcoin, they do not have complete control and cannot prevent a hardfork from occurring.The writer proposes a shorter difficulty algorithm averaging window to enable more, faster oscillations to enable better price discovery before a winner is chosen. The writer suggests a reward function to reduce oscillations and assist better price discovery. A faster measurement of hashrate for difficulty enables the economic determination to be more efficient and correct. Roger Ver and other holders have an interest in low price and more transactions. They think that a coin with more transactions, lower price, and lower fees per coin transferred will attract more merchants, customers, and miners. Forks with a faster difficulty will be more capable of retaining value. Devs should seek peaceful and sustainable forks of bitcoin. This will enable constant value, security, and low transaction fees per coin transfer.
